ratings.comment:
AMAZING!!!! The best lecturer in a tough course. He makes ACCT301 easier to learn by explaining all the concepts clearly and he is very humorous. He can make people who hate accounting fall in love with it. 
It remains a challenging course. Be ready to dedicate ample time to studying and reading the textbook and don't miss any lecture.
Tough class, but the professor was amazing. He explained everything clearly and detailed.

Russell was the best accounting lecturer I have had yet. Accounting is a relatively boring subject but he tried to make it as interesting as possible. He really cares about his students and I enjoyed going to his class. He is great at explaining difficult concepts and making them easy. Study for the tests (especially multiple choice).

Russell does a good job of making accounting interesting however he can. However, what makes his class so special is that in addition, he likes to tell you about about his life or just life in general. You leave with so much more knowledge than just accounting. By the end of the class, you'll finally appreciate why it's a great day for accounting.

Epp truly knows how to make accounting fun. It is clear that he is passionate about the subject and wants his students to succeed. Makes lectures interesting by showing funny pictures/sharing stories at the beginning of class. Even as someone who doesn't like accounting, I didn't dread coming to his class at all.

Epp is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. His expectations are clear and he really cares about his students. Note taking slides are very helpful for studying, and exams are difficult but graded on a huge curve. Two weeks into class he knew everyone's name. If you can take 301 with Epp, do it!

Russell is just an all around excellent professor. He is warm, caring, and respected by his students. He does a great job making this class enjoyable. The exams and quizzes are quite difficult, however all the material and resources you need are there. He is happy to help if you are struggling to understand material.

Prof. Epp is by far the best professor I have had during college. He gives very useful lectures that are clear and understandable. He is also always accessible to help students out, truly wanting you to succeed. Overall, he's a rockstar!

Best professor I've ever had at UW. His lectures are very easy to follow and he's very approachable if you need help. He understands that a lot of people don't like accounting so he makes lectures funny and throws in pop culture references. Ask him why he says "It's a great day for accounting" at the start of every class

Russell is a truly inspiring teacher. You can tell that he only wants the best for his students and genuinely cares about their understanding of the course material. Would definitely take a course with him again if given the opportunity.

One of the best professors I have ever had. He's knowledgeable and experienced in the field, and he gives the extremely organized and clear lectures. Don't be intimidated by him; he's very nice and he seems to care a lot about being a great professor. The things you learn in management accounting actually apply to the real world.
Rusty was the best professor I've had at Madison. He truly cares about every student and does what he can to make all of us succeed. I highly recommend taking him for any class that you can.

Amazing teacher that is very energetic, positive, and fun. He explains things very clearly - I agree with the last two posters that he is methodical, ties course material together nicely, and was born to teach accounting. I'm bummed he isn't teaching my other courses. Always available and happy to go over material you don't understand.
Methodical lectures that prepare you for the exams. He also ties course material from different chapters together nicely.
Born to teach accounting. Great guy and amazing teacher.
One of the best accounting professors I have had in college. Really cares about the material and makes sure that students understand concepts and how they are related.

Russell is one of the coolest profs you will every have... if you can get into his classes you should. He is a very detailed lecturer and an interesting person, one of the best profs I've had overall. He loves accounting, and always says "today is a great day for accounting"

Awesome professor, even if you're not an accounting major (which I am not). Makes a difficult class manageable by clearly explaining everything and making sure students understand it. Maybe a little intimidating, but don't be afraid to go get help.

Great guy, truly loves what he teaches. Accounting isn't for everyone, so don't be afraid to go get help - even if he can come across as a little intimidating. Great guy, great teacher, tough class, but he makes it interesting and engaging.

Russell is hands-down the best professor I've had in the business school so far.  He is extremely knowledgeable, full of cool stories, and really just wants to help everyone enjoy accounting just as much as he does.  He's super supportive and very helpful in office hours.  Definitely try and get him for Accounting 301.

Russell is the bomb. He tells you how it is and is methodical in his approach to teaching the bits of accounting that can be confusing, such as non monetary exchange, etc. I thought the tests were fair but challenging. Overall it was a great class which i recommend.

Russell is the best! He explains material so clearly and he takes the time to get to know his students. He must have an amazing memory because he remembers everything! Would 100% recommend taking a class with him if you can!
Russell is a great professor! He is super passionate and explains the material really well. His sections always seem to do the best.
